document_title: NVIDIA Corporation: Q324 earnings beat driven by data center strength
document_content: NVIDIA reported Q3 FY2024 revenue of $18.12 billion, up 206% year-over-year, significantly exceeding Street expectations of $16.18 billion. Data Center revenue reached $14.51 billion, up 279% YoY, representing 80% of total revenue. The company's H100 and H200 GPUs remain in high demand from cloud service providers, enterprises, and sovereign AI initiatives. Gaming revenue was $2.86 billion (+81% YoY), Professional Visualization reached $416 million (+108% YoY), and Automotive generated $261 million (+4% YoY). Gross margin expanded to 75.0%, up from 53.6% a year ago, driven by premium AI accelerator pricing. Operating income reached $10.02 billion, with operating margin of 55.3%. Net income was $9.24 billion, up 593% YoY. Diluted EPS was $0.37, versus $0.05 in the prior year. For Q4 FY2024, NVIDIA guides revenue to approximately $20.0 billion ±2%, with gross margin expected around 74.5%. The company declared a quarterly dividend of $0.04 per share. CEO Jensen Huang noted that generative AI adoption has reached an inflection point, with enterprises across industries implementing AI computing infrastructure. The company highlighted strong demand for its Spectrum-X Ethernet networking platform and announced partnerships with major cloud providers for next-generation AI services. Management emphasized continued investment in R&D for next-generation Blackwell architecture GPUs, expected to launch in 2024. Key growth drivers include: (1) expanding AI adoption across industries beyond technology, (2) sovereign AI initiatives in multiple countries, (3) growing demand for AI inference workloads, and (4) transition to accelerated computing architectures. Risks include potential supply chain constraints, competitive pressures from AMD and custom silicon, and geopolitical uncertainties affecting China sales.
expected_summary: NVIDIA reported exceptional Q3 FY2024 results with revenue of $18.12B (+206% YoY), beating estimates by 12%. Data Center led with $14.51B (+279% YoY), driven by strong H100/H200 GPU demand. Gaming revenue reached $2.86B (+81%), while gross margin expanded to 75.0% from 53.6% YoY. Net income surged to $9.24B (+593%), with EPS of $0.37 vs $0.05 prior year. Q4 revenue is guided to ~$20B, with gross margin around 74.5%. The company declared a $0.04 quarterly dividend. Management highlighted AI adoption inflection point, Spectrum-X networking momentum, and upcoming Blackwell architecture launch.
generated_summary:
## NVIDIA Q3 FY2024 Earnings Summary

**Financial Performance:** NVIDIA delivered outstanding Q3 results with revenue of $18.12B (+206% YoY), significantly exceeding consensus of $16.18B. Data Center dominated with $14.51B (+279% YoY), accounting for 80% of total revenue, driven by exceptional H100/H200 GPU demand from hyperscalers and enterprises. Gaming contributed $2.86B (+81% YoY), Professional Visualization $416M (+108%), and Automotive $261M (+4%). 

**Profitability Expansion:** Gross margin reached 75.0%, up from 53.6% YoY, reflecting premium AI accelerator pricing power. Operating income hit $10.02B with 55.3% margin. Net income surged to $9.24B (+593% YoY), translating to EPS of $0.37 vs $0.05 prior year.

**Outlook & Strategic Highlights:** Q4 revenue guided to ~$20B ±2% with ~74.5% gross margin. Quarterly dividend of $0.04 declared. CEO emphasized generative AI reaching inflection point across industries. Key growth vectors include: expanding AI adoption beyond tech sector, sovereign AI programs globally, inference workload growth, and accelerated computing transition. Spectrum-X Ethernet platform gaining traction; Blackwell GPU architecture launch targeted for 2024. Notable risks: supply constraints, AMD/custom silicon competition, China geopolitical headwinds.

**Investment View:** Results underscore NVIDIA's dominant position in AI infrastructure buildout. Strong guidance and expanding margins support bullish thesis, though elevated valuation warrants monitoring competitive dynamics and geopolitical developments.
